publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-762 Ben Wallace: RUC Award-That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Ulster Constabulary on its award of the George Cross and recognises the bravery of its men and women and their contribution towards combating terrorism and crime in both Northern Ireland and Scotland. Supported by: Alex Fergusson*
S1M-762 RUC Award (lodged on 12 April 2000) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S1M-762 Ben Wallace: RUC Award—That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Ulster Constabulary on its award of the George Cross and recognises the bravery of its men and women and their contribution towards combating terrorism and crime in both Northern Ireland and Scotland. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton

S1M-762 Ben Wallace: RUC Award—That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Ulster Constabulary on its award of the George Cross and recognises the bravery of its men and women and their contribution towards combating terrorism and crime in both Northern Ireland and Scotland. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-762 RUC Award (lodged on 12 April 2000) Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-762 Ben Wallace: RUC Award—That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Ulster Constabulary on its award of the George Cross and recognises the bravery of its men and women and their contribution towards combating terrorism and crime in both Northern Ireland and Scotland. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Keith Harding, Phil Gallie*

S1M-762 Ben Wallace: RUC Award-That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Ulster Constabulary on its award of the George Cross and recognises the bravery of its men and women and their contribution towards combating terrorism and crime in both Northern Ireland and Scotland. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Keith Harding, Phil Gallie
S1M-762 RUC Award (lodged on 12 April 2000) David McLetchie*

S1M-762 Ben Wallace: RUC Award—That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Ulster Constabulary on its award of the George Cross and recognises the bravery of its men and women and their contribution towards combating terrorism and crime in both Northern Ireland and Scotland. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Keith Harding, Phil Gallie, David McLetchie

S1M-762 Ben Wallace: RUC Award—That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Ulster Constabulary on its award of the George Cross and recognises the bravery of its men and women and their contribution towards combating terrorism and crime in both Northern Ireland and Scotland. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Keith Harding, Phil Gallie, David McLetchie

S1M-762 Ben Wallace: RUC Award-That the Parliament congratulates the Royal Ulster Constabulary on its award of the George Cross and recognises the bravery of its men and women and their contribution towards combating terrorism and crime in both Northern Ireland and Scotland. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Keith Harding, Phil Gallie, David McLetchie, Nick Johnston*
